name: Fantasies, Hoaxes and Misrepresentations of the Ancient World
description: The anatomy of significant hoaxes, outrageous claims, and archaeology in popular culture are examined. Why are these claims so popular? How do we critically evaluate potential hoaxes and fictional accounts of the past? What role has racism played in these views? This course provides the tools for evaluation of these claims as well as for the lifetime enjoyment of what is truly exciting about archaeology. [24L]
